intro: Bohadschia hirta, commonly known as the spiny sea hare, is a species of sea slug found in the Indo-Pacific region. It belongs to the family Aplysiidae and is characterized by its elongated, soft body covered in small, spiny tubercles. The animal is typically green to brown in color, with a distinct, wrinkled appearance. It feeds primarily on algae and is often found in shallow coastal waters. This species plays a role in marine ecosystems by contributing to the grazing of algae and serving as prey for various marine predators.
